titles.title: Waiving points of order against the conference report to accompany the bill (H.R. 927) to seek international sanctions against the Castro government in Cuba, to plan for support of a transition government leading to a democratically elected government in Cuba, and for other purposes.

action.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 104-470, by Mr. Diaz-Balart.

Rule provides for consideration of the conference report to H.R. 927 with 1 hour of general debate. Upon adoption of this resolution, all points of order against the conference report accompanying the bill and against its consideration shall be waived.

calendar.text: Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 186.

action.text: DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate.

vote.text: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 347 - 67 (Roll no. 46).

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary: 3/5/1996--Introduced. Waives points of order against the consideration of the conference report on H.R. 927 (sanctions against Cuba).
